body_html:
TensorFlow is no longer exporting any symbols globally, which sounds like the original issue? The protobuf refactoring is still useful and ongoing AFAIK, but turned out to be tangential. And we'd still like to split more of our dependencies into separate shared objects, also ongoing.

I'll close this, but @skye feel free to reopen if you had something else in mind.
body_text:
TensorFlow is no longer exporting any symbols globally, which sounds like the original issue? The protobuf refactoring is still useful and ongoing AFAIK, but turned out to be tangential. And we'd still like to split more of our dependencies into separate shared objects, also ongoing.
I'll close this, but @skye feel free to reopen if you had something else in mind.
body:
TensorFlow is [no longer exporting any symbols globally](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/5c7f9e316d8c7735308a217310350d416d7498cc), which sounds like the original issue? The protobuf refactoring is still useful and ongoing AFAIK, but turned out to be tangential. And we'd still like to split more of our dependencies into separate shared objects, also ongoing.

I'll close this, but @skye feel free to reopen if you had something else in mind.
